item.title: The two major political parties in the United States – the Democratic Party and the Republican Party.
item.description:
The Democratic Party and the Republican Party exhibit significant differences in political ideology, policy proposals, and social values.

Political Ideologies and Policy Positions

  • Democratic Party: Leans towards liberal/left-wing, advocating for the government to play an active role in economic and social affairs, supporting social welfare, environmental protection, and multiculturalism. Regarding tax policy, the Democratic Party supports tax cuts for low- and middle-income individuals while increasing taxes on high earners and corporations. On social issues, the Democratic Party supports abortion rights, same-sex marriage, and advocates for strict gun control. In foreign policy, the Democratic Party emphasizes multilateralism and diplomatic means, preferring to address global problems through international cooperation.
  • Republican Party: Leans towards conservative, advocating for limited government intervention, emphasizing individual liberty and a free market economy. Regarding tax policy, the Republican Party supports tax cuts, believing they should apply to everyone regardless of income. On social issues, the Republican Party opposes abortion and same-sex marriage, supports the right to bear arms.

The Significance of Trump’s Ascension

Donald Trump was re-elected as President of the United States in 2024, marking the Republican Party’s dominance in American politics. Trump’s policy positions included:

  • Economic Policy: Trump advocated for stimulating economic growth through tax cuts and deregulation, particularly supporting the development of traditional manufacturing and energy industries. He also favored protectionist trade policies, renegotiating or withdrawing from existing trade agreements to protect America’s economic interests.
  • Immigration Policy: Trump planned to strengthen border security, restrict illegal immigration, and implement stricter scrutiny and limitations on legal immigrants. He also supported limiting refugees and asylum seekers to maintain national security. - Foreign Policy: Trump favored a unilateral approach, emphasizing “America First,” reducing reliance on international organizations, reevaluating relationships with allies, and employing tougher diplomatic measures when necessary. He also planned to expand fossil fuel production and usage and loosen restrictions on environmental protection.

Trump’s potential second term could lead to significant adjustments in U.S. domestic policy and have a profound impact on global politics and economics. His policies were likely to draw attention and reaction from the international community, particularly in areas such as trade, environment, and human rights.

item.title: DeepSeek suddenly went viral before the Spring Festival, NVIDIA stock plummeted: The behind institutional operations and the chain of thought for large models.
item.description:
Prior to the Spring Festival, DeepSeek had become a hot topic, attracting widespread attention on social media in just a few days. This sudden surge in popularity was surprising and triggered a chain reaction in the market. Meanwhile, NVIDIA’s stock price plummeted, raising concerns among many investors, with some institutions conducting large-scale short selling during this period, seemingly pointing to a “carefully orchestrated” situation.

DeepSeek’s Sudden Surge in Popularity: Rapidly Becoming a Focus

DeepSeek is an AI-powered tool focused on optimizing deep learning models, particularly in the application of natural language processing (NLP) and image generation. In the days leading up to Chinese New Year, this project suddenly garnered significant attention from investors and tech professionals alike. The performance of its team and the demonstrated technical results sparked strong interest among many. Discussions about DeepSeek dominated all topics within the developer community and on social media platforms.

However, DeepSeek’s sudden surge in popularity was not accidental. After analysis, many began to suspect that certain entities may have been involved behind it.

Nvidia Stock Plummets: The Hand Behind the Short Selling Operation

Nvidia, a global leader in graphics processing units (GPUs), has long been a key hardware provider for many large models and AI computations. With the rapid development of the AI market, Nvidia’s stock has performed strongly over the long term and even become a favorite among many investors. However, with the explosive popularity of DeepSeek and the market’s intense focus on its technology, Nvidia’s stock experienced a dramatic plunge. The underlying cause of this phenomenon may involve institutional investor short selling strategies. Over the past few years, as AI technology has spread, Nvidia’s stock price has been significantly inflated, leading many investors to believe that it carries risks of excessive speculation. Particularly after a technology like DeepSeek went viral, some institutions may have profited substantially by shorting Nvidia’s stock.

Chain-of-Thought Reasoning with Large Models: From “Results” to “Process”

In traditional artificial intelligence applications, many practitioners and investors have focused more on the “results” of AI models – such as generated images or text outputs. In discussions related to DeepSeek, however, an increasing number of people are beginning to realize that the underlying chain-of-thought is the core content worth paying attention to behind large models. Previously, we could only see the results of model output, but now we need to understand the logic, algorithms, and how to optimize model performance by adjusting these factors.

This shift in thinking represents a deep reflection on AI research and application. From simple black-box operations to a genuine shift towards understanding the internal workings of models, leading many technologists and investors to re-evaluate the future direction of artificial intelligence. The popularity of DeepSeek perfectly represents a breakthrough in this thought chain, prompting people to focus on the entire model construction and optimization process rather than just the final output results.

Summary

The sudden surge in popularity of DeepSeek, NVIDIA’s stock plummet, and the subsequent short-selling activities by institutions – it all seems like a meticulously designed scheme. Through an in-depth understanding of large model chain-of-thought reasoning, we can see that the application of AI technology is not merely superficial layering of phenomena, but also deep digging and optimization of the model’s internal logic. As the technology progresses, we may see more innovative tools like DeepSeek in the future, driving AI research and applications to a higher level.

This phenomenon not only shows us the immense potential of AI technology, but also prompts us to start thinking about the commercial games and capital operations behind the technology. The future market trend will continue to be the focus of the battle between technology and capital.

item.title: The End of the Age of Barbaric Capital: The End of the League of Legends Esports Era
item.description:
The esports industry has experienced rapid development over the past decade and a half, becoming an increasingly significant cultural phenomenon worldwide. Particularly games like League of Legends (LoL), a MOBA title, have not only provided players with competitive enjoyment but also injected substantial momentum into capital investment, driving the flourishing development of various esports platforms and events. However, this all entered a phase of gradual decline alongside increased capital influx and the rise of the broader entertainment industry. The rise and fall of PandyTV, the competition between DouYu and Huya, marked the end of the “wild capitalism era,” and it seems that the favorable conditions – time, place, people, and heaven – for esports are also beginning to change.

Chapter 1: The Rise of Esports and Capital Injection

1.1 Early Esports: From Grassroots to Professionalization The early esports industry started relatively grassroots, especially in the Chinese market. Many players participated in competitive games like StarCraft and Dota, driven by their love for gaming. However, the true rise of esports began with the release and promotion of League of Legends. Following the official entry of League of Legends into the Chinese market in 2011, esports gradually evolved from a niche community to become part of mainstream culture. Notably, starting in 2013, the LPL (China Professional League) began to form, and League of Legends became the cornerstone of China’s esports industry. 1.2 Capital Flood: The Rise of PandaTV and Esports Streaming Platforms 2015 marked a watershed moment for China’s esports industry. The influx of capital transformed esports from purely competitive events into a much larger ecosystem. Pandahua (PandaTV), as one representative, became a product of excessive capital. Funded by Wang Sicong (one of the founders of PandaLive), Pandahua quickly rose to prominence with its innovative content and massive investment, attracting a large number of viewers and users. However, this was also a typical example of capital “barbaric” inflow – the market’s frantic pursuit of capital often lacks patience and long-term vision. Although Pandahua’s financial and human resources achieved certain results in the short term, it ultimately declared bankruptcy in 2019 due to management issues and excessive reliance on capital.

1.3 Live Streaming Platform Competition: The “Capital War” between DouYu and Huya

Chapter 1: The Rise of Esports and Capital Injection

The decline of PandaTV did not lead to a decline in the esports live streaming industry; instead, it fueled the rise of platforms like DouYu and Huya. The two major live streaming platforms quickly became leaders in the esports industry, with competition between them intensifying. DouYu initially established itself as a benchmark for esports live streaming through its broadcasts of professional League of Legends tournaments and by signing top streamers. Meanwhile, Huya gradually narrowed the gap with DouYu through increased investment in esports events and its own diversified platform layout.

Throughout this process, capital played a significant role once again. In 2018, DouYu successfully went public, and Huya also completed an IPO the same year. The rapid flow of capital led to industry consolidation and resulted in intense competition between platforms regarding streamers and copyrights, forming a “capital battle.”

Chapter 2: The Fusion of Mass Entertainment and Esports

2.1 The Trend Towards Mass Entertainment: Capital Flows into Diversified Entertainment Projects

With significant capital investment in the esports industry, esports platforms are gradually moving towards mass entertainment. Esports anchors no longer limit themselves to match commentary and event broadcasts; they begin to expand into singing, dancing, live interaction, and other forms of entertainment. The content on the platform becomes more diverse, gradually forming an ecosystem centered around esports but incorporating various entertainment elements.

However, this trend towards mass entertainment has also brought problems – the original focus of esports culture is being marginalized, replaced by a trend of “entertainment above all.” This trend has caused some fans who originally loved esports culture to feel alienated, and capital is increasingly turning its attention to other entertainment fields. - Excessive capital influx and profit-seeking have gradually blurred the essence of the esports industry, with core values centered around competition weakening. 2.2 The Rise of Pan-Entertainment Industry: Capital Withdrawal and Transformation As short video platforms, live streaming platforms, and the entertainment industry (including K-pop) have risen, capital has gradually shifted funds from esports to a broader range of entertainment content. In this process, giants such as Tencent, Alibaba, and ByteDance no longer rely solely on esports projects for profit, but have increased their investments in areas such as film, music, and short videos. In particular, the rise of ByteDance, through the explosive growth of platforms like Douyin (TikTok), has overshadowed esports with other entertainment content.

Chapter Three: League of Legends’ “Yellow Doesn’t Follow Yellow”: The Decline of the Era’s Advantage

Since League of Legends entered the Chinese market in 2011, it has almost been synonymous with China’s esports industry, achieving countless professional players, teams, and events, and also spawning a massive esports ecosystem. However, after more than a decade, as a leading project in Chinese esports, League of Legends has entered a phase of “Yellow Doesn’t Follow Yellow.” Particularly in recent years, the influence of League of Legends is gradually declining, even exhibiting obvious signs of decline.

3.1 The “Fracture” in Player Demographics

The most noticeable change is the fragmentation of player demographics. Initially, the rapid development of esports relied on the support of a large number of young players who became professional players or spectators thanks to League of Legends. That generation of internet addiction teenagers almost grew up under the “timeshare dividend,” immersed in the competitive appeal of League of Legends. This, in turn, drove the rapid expansion of the entire industry. However, as time passed, these players gradually matured and entered society, shifting towards other life and career paths. Simultaneously, a new generation of young players didn’t show the same fervor for League of Legends as in previous years, and the esports audience has developed a noticeable age bias and decline in interest.

Chapter 3: League of Legends’ “Yellow Never Follows Green”: The Decline of the Era’s Advantage

3.2 The “Stagnation” of Game Content

League of Legends, despite numerous updates and revisions, has begun to show signs of stagnation in its competitive appeal. Annual version releases, hero balance adjustments, and the introduction of new gameplay mechanics seem unable to fundamentally address players’ demand for fresh content. Simultaneously, the MOBA market has become increasingly saturated, with other games (such as Honor of Kings and PUBG Mobile) rapidly rising in popularity and diverting a significant portion of League of Legends’ player base. This competitive landscape has left League of Legends perpetually playing the role of “follower,” unable to break free from its position.

Conclusion: Where Does the Esports Industry Go From Here?

The esports industry is like a skyscraper that sprung up seemingly overnight. Excessive capital roams within the internet industry, searching for the next big trend, and esports has become one of their targets. Leveraging China’s demographic dividend, the esports industry achieved tremendous success in a short period. However, this success wasn’t built on a solid foundation. Over-investment by capital, talent shortages, and weak game content are all hindering the healthy development of the esports industry. Prior to university, I didn’t play many games, and the League of Legends was essentially a companion throughout my growth. I watched so many World Championships, and as an outsider, comparing Chinese and Korean players, especially Faker, domestic players always felt apprehensive and hesitant during major tournaments. I also understand that professional gamers face immense psychological pressure, but this industry has developed for over ten years, and their mental health issues should be prioritized by the teams – which they weren’t. Domestic gameplay still relies on individual player talent.

item.title: From Games to Home: Why We Gradually Distance Ourselves from the Virtual World as We Grow Up
item.description:
When did I ever feel the most joy playing games? As a child, sneaking onto my parents’ TV to play Tank War, Super Mario, and Space Invaders, or secretly using our computer with my cousin to play Age of Empires – or even in college, playing Devil May Cry and League of Legends with my roommates?

As a child, there were no worries about life, and when we played, we truly immersed ourselves completely. That sense of immersion is something you can never find again as an adult.

With the changes in times and social progress, those of us who once thrived in the virtual world have gradually realized that the platform filled with joy and competition seems to be drifting away from our lives. The disconnection of game social links, accompanied by players falling out of line, is not only due to technological advancements and the replacement of games themselves, but also because of a shift in our center of gravity in life.

The Disappearance of Gaming Socialization: A Tug-of-War Between Virtual and Real Worlds

For many people’s youth, games were more than just entertainment; they were a social way to connect. A popular multiplayer online game didn’t just offer in-game challenges and competition – it connected players from all over the world, building virtual social circles. Back then, playing dungeons together, forming teams for PvP combat, was part of everyday life. Those late-night voice chats and sharing of daily experiences became a cherished part of our memories.

However, as time went on, more and more players realized that this experience of virtual socialization didn’t have lasting appeal. With the constant updates and evolution of games, and the diversification of social platforms, players gradually found more interactive ways to connect outside of gaming.

Gaming and Responsibility: The Shift in Focus of Adult Life

As you enter adulthood, responsibilities gradually increase. Many young people once invested a significant amount of time in games, but as their careers begin or they start living with partners and forming families, these activities that previously seemed indispensable entertainment are increasingly squeezed by the demands of real-life responsibility. Marriage, having children, even caring for parents, all these major life responsibilities force individuals to make choices about their energy and time.

Gaming becomes a thing of the past, replaced by the priority of family life. Many young people who once “fought” in games gradually discover that real life is the most important subject. Especially after having children, the focus of life completely shifts towards family, and gaming is gradually pushed to the periphery of life.

From Games to Home: How Life Changes Influence Our Entertainment

Within our life experiences, the family is one of the most important components. And once you enter family life, the division of time and energy becomes more specific and limited. Many young parents find that they no longer have enough time to focus on games they used to love, especially in order to care for children and spend time with their spouses. They often even stop chasing updates and new features in games. Gradually, social platforms and offline interactions with friends and family have become the preferred way for more people to socialize.

This doesn’t mean we completely abandon entertainment activities; it simply means we’ve chosen ways that better suit our current life stage.

The Farewell of Virtual Worlds: How Do We View This Transition?

For many who were once immersed in games, saying goodbye to gaming social wasn’t easy. After all, the virtual world that had once brought us joy and accomplishment had long become a part of our memories. However, farewell doesn’t necessarily mean complete severance; it’s about making different choices as life changes, balancing our roles in real-life. As we grow older from our youthful beginnings into responsible adults, games may still have their value, but they can no longer be the main rhythm of our lives.

In reality, this transition also reflects a facet of human adaptability – our ability to adjust our focus and lifestyle as different stages of life unfold.

The Future of Gaming: Perhaps We’ll See Another Wave of “Sense of Belonging”

Of course, as society and technology continue to develop, the forms and content of games are constantly evolving. For example, modern multiplayer online games have begun to evolve towards more relaxed and flexible ways, with some designs even focusing on family interaction and parent-child relationships. In the future, we may see more game formats that can better integrate into family life and provide players with healthier, more balanced social experiences.

Just as many people reminisce about “games from their childhood” with nostalgia and passion, perhaps in a moment of unintentional discovery, we will pick up those games again, bringing with us new understanding and insight, and re-enter that virtual world.

Living in Change, Yet Still Loving

Whether it’s games or family life, the changes in our lives always accompany us as we grow. In this process, we gradually realize that, although the virtual world brings us endless joy and excitement, ultimately, we will return to reality, back to the warmest place of all – family. We don’t need to regret leaving games behind because every stage of life has its own unique meaning. And these changes are what make us a more complete person.

item.title: Town Brahmin: The “Big Man” of Small Places
item.description:
• Recently, the popular “Da Bing” (Big Ice) on Douyin (TikTok) has been frequently seen with short video accounts extracted from her live streams. A listener who joined a live call asked: “Da Bing, I want to sell my house in Xi’an and return home to settle down.” Da Bing responded: “At your age, you’re in your early thirties; you can’t settle down. Your parents are on the path of aging, your children haven’t started a family or established themselves, and if you return home, you’ll still have to deal with the parames (婆罗门) in the small county.”

  • Let’s put aside whether the viewpoint is right or wrong, what does the term “parames” (婆罗门) mean?

Township Brahmins: The “Big Shots” of Small Places

In many small county towns, people often talk about so-called “township brahmins”—the existence of these individuals seems to be a symbol of local society. They are not necessarily genuine religious figures and do not possess “high-level” titles; rather, they are seemingly ordinary but nonetheless influential people. They represent “power, status, and influence” within that county town, symbolizing a particular class or stratum in that area.

What is an “Xiancheng Babao?”

First, we need to understand that “Babao” originally referred to the highest caste in Indian society, representing wisdom, authority, and spiritual supremacy. In China’s county towns, the term “Xiancheng Babao” doesn’t have such a complex religious background; it’s more of a metaphor for a social phenomenon.

Simply put, an “Xiancheng Babao” can be understood as some “cultural authorities” within the county town – such as teachers, doctors, well-known merchants, and officials, etc. Although their positions may seem ordinary, in this relatively closed environment, they possessed a comparatively higher social status, or their opinions and actions had influence that could not be ignored.

Who is the “Township Brahmin”?

In towns and counties, you’ll often find figures like this – the “Brahmin.” They might be:

  • Educators: Particularly teachers who have spent decades working in the area, not necessarily graduates of prestigious universities, but who understand how to build credibility through knowledge and are widely respected.
  • Local Government Officials: Deputy county magistrates, section chiefs, etc., who control certain resources and power – even if their positions aren’t high-ranking, their limited scope of authority can make them local “Brahmins.”
  • Local “Entrepreneurs”: Some business owners in rural towns, though not large in scale, hold a certain amount of wealth and have a voice in the community. They might operate one or two well-known local small businesses and wield considerable influence within the town.

The Status of “County Town Brahmins” – How Does it Impact Society?

To truly understand the significance of “county town brahmins,” we must consider the unique environment of the county town. Here, information flow is slower than in large cities, and social class mobility is more fixed. These “brahmins” often accumulated prestige, knowledge, and connections through long-term dedication to the local area. They influence various aspects of local politics, economics, and culture.

  1. Cultural Influence: In small places, especially where education systems may not be as developed and people have fewer choices, local “brahmins” subtly shape the cultural atmosphere through knowledge transmission in classrooms, explanations in media, and even moral guidance in social settings. Concentration of Social Resources: Due to the limited population and resources in county-level cities, these “Brahman” figures were often one of the primary controllers of local resources. Whether it was social welfare, policy implementation, or the approval of certain projects, they invariably exerted influence. Their power of speech and decision-making allowed them to hold a position within the local society.

  2. A Web of Interpersonal Relationships: In a relatively closed small community, interpersonal relationships are often crucial. These “county Brahman” figures established powerful social networks to control information flow and resource allocation, thereby playing a decisive role at critical moments.

The Metaphor of the “County Sharma”

Although the “county sharma” (or “town Brahmin”) is often regarded with respect and admiration, this position of privilege isn’t without its issues. In modern society, it’s not difficult to see that many county-level “sharmas” lack genuine ability and innovative spirit; instead, they maintain their positions through hereditary relationships and resource monopolies. With the development of informatization, these “sharmas’” power is gradually being eroded, and new social mobility is beginning to influence the appearance of small counties.

Overall, the “county sharma” is a fascinating social phenomenon that reflects the power and cultural structures within local societies. Although their “power” may not directly threaten national governance, they are undoubtedly key figures within the region.

Conclusion

item.title: Balancing Bank Marketing Strategies with the Art of Personal Financial Management
item.description:
Recently, the renovation project at home has led to a surge in daily expenses. I’ve also been using credit cards, paying them off within the billing cycle, although I have enough cash on hand, I prefer to keep it in money funds to earn some additional interest income. Furthermore, to ensure financial stability, I’ve set up automatic payment functionality so that my credit card bills can be paid promptly upon maturity.

Bank Status: Deposits Increase, Loans Decrease

Amidst increasing economic uncertainty, people are more inclined to save rather than consume or invest. This has led to an increase in bank deposits, but it also means banks have to pay higher interest rates to depositors. Conversely, due to reduced consumer and investment activity, loan demand has decreased, making it difficult for banks to generate interest income through lending.

To attract and retain customers, banks are forced to offer more competitive deposit rates, further compressing the bank’s net interest margin. Simultaneously, in order to stimulate economic growth and consumption, central banks may implement policies of lowering benchmark interest rates, which will also impact bank loan rates and consequently affect their profitability.

Banking Marketing Strategies: Cultivating User Habits

The due date was approaching quickly. First, the Bank of Communications contacted me, offering a one-year free installment service with no interest charges. Shortly after, China Merchants Bank also provided a 2.5% discount on installment interest rates, which translated to an annualized rate of 1.9%. Faced with these offers, I chose to accept installment services from both banks.

I realized that banks truly go all out to cultivate user habits. According to the bank’s definition of “flow,” I should be a premium customer. In the current context of difficulty for banks in lending and deploying funds, by cultivating my installment awareness, the bank is actually preparing for potential future liquidity difficulties from me, at which point they can earn more interest income from me. After all, as we know, interest rates on credit card bill analysis are not low. Banks, by offering free installment services and low-interest installment promotions, not only increased the frequency and limits of credit card usage but also established a positive image in the minds of users. This shift in strategy reflects the bank’s rapid response to market changes and its deep understanding of customer needs. In this way, the bank not only solved the problem of difficulty in lending funds but also laid the groundwork for future profits – it’s not just about making money today; looking ahead is key to long-term sustainability.

The Importance of Personal Financial Management

Despite the appealing offers of installment financing from banks, as users, we should recognize the risks associated with over-reliance on credit card installments. We should carefully consider our repayment ability and future financial needs to avoid falling into long-term debt traps due to short-term financial convenience. Key to personal financial management is balancing current needs with future planning.

item.title: The multifaceted nature of gaming: the intersection of psychological development and social entertainment.
item.description:
In today’s digital age, games have evolved far beyond a simple form of entertainment and have become an indispensable part of people’s daily lives. From a psychological perspective, games play different roles in the mental development of individuals across various age groups, while also being closely intertwined with social and recreational activities.

Mental State

Young people are in the stage of self-exploration and identity formation. Games provide them with a low-cost environment to try and explore. Through games, they can experiment with different roles and lifestyles, satisfying their curiosity and desire for exploration. As they grow older, individuals’ interests and values gradually stabilize, and games may no longer align with their life goals and interests.

Social Attributes

Simultaneously, the game has also become a part of social activities, particularly for young people. They make friends and build social networks through games, making games a bridge for socialization. However, as people age, their social circles gradually stabilize, and social needs may be met through more mature ways, leading to a relative reduction in the role of games in socialization.

Social Attributes: Bringing a Sister (with a female player)

Within China, due to a lack of adequate dating education, parents often simply expect you to study well and then immediately want you to start a relationship after graduation. This phenomenon is very common.

Because of busy studies, work, or a lack of social skills, individuals haven’t been able to establish stable emotional relationships in real life, leading to feelings of loneliness and a desire for attention. The “bringing a sister” behavior within games provides an outlet to release this craving. By helping and protecting female players, they can experience being needed and valued, gaining emotional satisfaction.

Furthermore, the interactive rules within games are clearly defined, and the environment is controllable, offering a sense of certainty and security compared to the complexity and uncertainty of real-life interactions, reducing fear of the uncertainties in real-world relationships. ## Social Attributes: Bringing a Sister (with a female player)

Within China, due to a lack of adequate dating education, parents often only taught you to study diligently and then immediately expected you to start a relationship after graduation. This phenomenon is quite common.

Because of busy studies, work, or a lack of social skills, individuals haven’t been able to establish stable emotional relationships in real life, leading to feelings of loneliness and a desire for attention. The “bringing a sister” behavior within games provides an outlet to release this craving. By helping and protecting female players, they can experience being needed and valued, achieving emotional satisfaction.

Furthermore, the interactive rules within games are clearly defined, and the environment is controllable, offering a sense of certainty and security compared to the complexity and uncertainty of real-life interactions, reducing fears associated with the unpredictability of real relationships.

Real-World Pressure

Games provide a virtual world where players can temporarily escape the pressures, challenges, or unpleasant emotions of real life. Particularly for young people facing academic pressure, family issues, or interpersonal relationship challenges, games may become a way to seek comfort and relaxation.

Games are typically designed to give players a sense of accomplishment and recognition when completing tasks, leveling up, or defeating opponents. Young people may become addicted to games because they can experience a feeling of being appreciated and recognized within them – a feeling that may be lacking in their real lives.

Dislike Playing After Getting Older

When young, individuals face relatively fewer social responsibilities and pressures, allowing them more time and energy to invest in gaming. As they enter the workforce, start families, and take on other societal responsibilities, time and energy become increasingly valuable, and games may be seen as a drain rather than a preferred leisure activity.

As people age, their cognitive abilities and interests also change. They might have been interested in fast-paced, visually stunning games when younger, but with increased experience, they may prefer strategy games, those with strong storylines, or games with greater depth. If the market doesn’t meet these changing needs, interest naturally diminishes.

  • Psychology is a key area in game design, particularly social psychology. Understanding people’s behavior, needs, and motivations can help create more engaging gaming experiences. Regarding the relationship between “showing off” (装逼) and social psychology, we can examine it from several angles:

  1. Social Validation: People often seek to establish a sense of belonging within social groups. In games, designing elements that allow players to feel accomplished and noticed by other players can increase their social validation. This may manifest as boasting skills or showcasing earned rewards.

  2. Social Competition: Some games employ social competition elements, encouraging players to showcase their achievements within a social network. This can be achieved through leaderboards, achievement systems, or multiplayer battles. Such designs stimulate competitive psychology among players, potentially leading some players to perform more exceptionally in order to gain social recognition.

  3. Self-Expression: Some games allow players to express themselves through customization options like character avatars and virtual items. This self-expression isn’t just about showing off; it can also be a way to express personality and engage in social interaction.

  4. Teamwork: Certain games emphasize teamwork, achieving game objectives through social interaction. In these scenarios, boasting behavior may not be encouraged but rather emphasizes collaboration and mutual support.

  5. Psychological Reward Systems: Game design can utilize psychological reward systems to incentivize positive social behaviors. For example, rewarding players or granting them privileges to encourage active participation in social interactions. Overall, the application of social psychology in game design can be used to shape player interaction and social experiences. Fluffing (or showing off) behavior can sometimes occur in certain contexts, but game designers typically strive to balance this behavior to ensure the gaming experience is positive and enjoyable for all players.

Single-player and online games are two different types of games with significant differences in gameplay, experience, and technology. Here are some key aspects to understand the distinction between single-player and online games:

  1. Connection Method:
    • Single-player Games (Offline/Single-player): These games are played on a local device independently, without requiring an internet connection. Players can enjoy the game experience even without network connectivity. - Online/Multiplayer Games: These games typically require an internet connection because players need to interact in real-time with other players. Online games can be cooperative or competitive, involving online social interaction and esports.

  • Player Interaction:

    • Single Player Games: Players primarily interact with in-game artificial intelligence, pre-set tasks, or hostile elements. The gaming experience is typically more personalized and influenced by the game’s design and storyline.
    • Multiplayer Games: Players can interact with other real players from around the world. This may include collaborating on missions, competing against each other, participating in esports, and social elements such as chat, guild systems, etc.

  • Game Design and Content:

    • Single Player Games: Game design focuses more on providing a complete and independent storyline and gaming experience. Game content is typically pre-designed, and players explore, solve puzzles, or engage in combat within the game.
    • Multiplayer Games: Game design needs to consider real-time interaction and player competition or collaboration. Game content may be more dynamic, including regular updates, online events, and social interaction.

  • Technical Requirements:

    • Single Player Games: Typically can run offline with relatively low requirements for device performance and internet connection.
    • Online Games: Require a strong internet connection and have high demands on server and network performance to ensure smooth real-time interactions.

  • Business Model:

    • Single Player Games: Typically employ a one-time purchase or download model, where players buy the game to play it fully on their local devices.
    • Online Games: May utilize various business models such as free-to-play, advertising, item purchases, or subscriptions to maintain server operations and continuously update game content. Understanding these distinctions helps players clarify their preferences when choosing games and enables game designers to better meet player expectations.
